basics.label: EXECUTIVE CHEF
basics.summary: Dedicated, hardworking restaurant management professional with extensive daily planning and operations experience. Skilled in staff training and development. Previously managed more than 20 employees and organized small and large scaled events, including weddings and banquets. Highly dedicated in career growth.

work.name: Saint Joseph's College
work.summary: Created a farm to table culture in the caf√©, utilizing the college's farms produce and livestock as well as creating business relationships with local farms, artisans, and other family owned companies. Supervised the daily conduct of the Chefs and Sous Chefs. Prices all menu and catering items.
highlights: Developed popular daily specials with locally sourced ingredients.
Planned and prepared food for parties, holiday meals, luncheons, special functions, and other events.
Guest Chef at the Northern New England Home and Garden Show Meet the Chef Series

work.name: Company
work.summary: Prepped food for the kitchen, created specials for the dinner and lunch menu, cooked food for large banquets. In charge of training new cooks.

work.name: Company
work.summary: Prepped food for the line, cooked everything from appetizers to fried food, to the main dishes. Developed strong multi-tasking skills by working alone in a busy kitchen.

work.name: Company
work.summary: Prepped food for line, cooked appetizers, soups, sandwiches, and all fried foods. Developed strong communication skills by working in a high pace kitchen environment.

keywords: High level of aesthetic and culinary execution
Works well as a part of a team
